thread.title: Alabama junior beginning to make impact as pass rusher
thread.title_full: Alabama junior beginning to make impact as pass rusher | AL.com

author: Matt Zenitz | mzenitz@al.com
title: Alabama junior beginning to make impact as pass rusher
text:
Alabama senior linebacker Reggie Ragland had a conversation with junior outside linebacker Tim Williams earlier this year that was intended to serve as both motivation and a challenge.
"I told Tim, you're going on your third year, and it's time for him to step up and be the man that you can be because if he puts his mind to it he can be the best pass rusher in the country," Ragland said. "He can lead the country in sacks. That's how fast and physical he is. He's just got to keep getting in that playbook and keep learning it because I know he's physical. He's got to come in. And if [he does] what he's got to do, he's going to be hard to stop."
Williams has started to make an impact as a pass rusher during the Tide's last two games.
Seeing increased playing time as one of Alabama's reserve outside linebackers, the 6-foot-4, 230-pound Williams posted 1.5 tackles for a loss, a half-sack and a quarterback hurry during the Tide's 34-0 win over Louisiana Monroe and a sack in Alabama's 38-10 win over Georgia last Saturday.
Williams was one of Alabama's players of the week following the win over ULM.
RELATED: Redshirt freshman guard has been one of Alabama's 2 most consistent O-linemen, Nick Saban says
The sack against Georgia came on the last play of the first half.
Williams got past Bulldogs three-year starter at right tackle, Kolton Houston, and sacked quarterback Brice Ramsey after he stepped up in the pocket.
Williams had just one tackle with no stops for a loss, sacks or quarterback hurries in the Tide's first three games. He has three tackles, 2.5 stops for a loss, 1.5 sacks and a quarterback hurry in the last two games.
The Louisiana native recorded only eight tackles and 1.5 sacks during his first two seasons at Alabama.
"Tim has always been a good pass rusher," coach Nick Saban said. "The biggest issue is getting him to play with the kind of discipline to do his job the way he needs to do it, and that's the one thing he's matured into during this year. We have a greater trust in playing him, and he has been more productive. He's been much more consistent as a player, and that's what we look for in all of our players."
Williams ran the 40-yard dash in 4.75 seconds during Alabama's spring testing.
His 545-pound squat was the best among Tide linebackers. His 315-pound power clean was tied for the best. He also bench-pressed 405 pounds. That was tied for sixth-best on the team among non-linemen.
"Tim always had that it factor about him," outside linebacker Ryan Anderson said, later adding, "Tim is going to be a great player."
Nick Saban Press Conference Videos, Oct. 07, 2015 Nick Saban talks about Arkansas Wednesday at his press conference.
